examples: The book describes her life from cradle to grave.
But the lawyers also described internal politics that at times slowed down the department's work or drove a wedge among members of the team.
And after the match, the Carlisle boss wasn't pulling his punches when describing his players' performance.
BBC is falling over backwards to be impartial by describing this as a crowd!
It was described as a large, luxury mobile home, but there was barely room to swing a cat.
words.defineEn: to give details about someone or something to say what they are like
words.defineVi: để cung cấp thông tin chi tiết về một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó để nói họ như thế nào

examples: Put your clothes in the cupboard.
She gave him presents and clothes.
All clothes are in mint condition and less than two years old.
She received many compliments on her stylish clothes.
My clothes won't all go in that one suitcase.
words.defineEn: the things we wear to cover our body, such as pants, shirts, and jackets
words.defineVi: những thứ chúng ta mặc để che thân, chẳng hạn như quần, áo sơ mi và áo khoác

examples: The team's new manager brings ten years' experience to the job.
The new loan takes the total debt to $100 000.
The new president takes office in January.
Fans have given the band's new song their seal of approval.
The organization called the new regulations a turning point in the campaign against smoking.
words.defineVi: được xây dựng, phát minh, chế tạo gần đây, v.v.

examples: My father is quite old now
This thankless IT support job is really getting old.
This old house gives me the willies.
The old man gave up the ghost.
The old man considered his granddaughter thoughtfully.
words.defineEn: (of a thing) having been used or existing for a long period of time
words.defineVi: (của một thứ) đã được sử dụng hoặc tồn tại trong một thời gian dài

examples: She found a dirty stain on her favorite shirt.
She had to clean her dirty car after a long road trip.
He wore dirty shoes that left muddy footprints on the floor.
The dirty dishes in the restaurant's kitchen needed to be washed.
He had a dirty face after playing in the mud.
words.defineEn: having stains, bacteria, marks, or dirt
words.defineVi: có vết bẩn, vi khuẩn, vết hoặc bụi bẩn

examples: The mother gently cleaned her baby's ears with a cotton swab.
A new broom sweeps clean, after all.
Sarah cleans the kitchen counters with a sponge.
She had to clean her dirty car after a long road trip.
She cleans the dining room after each meal.
words.defineEn: not having any stains, bacteria, marks, or dirt
words.defineVi: không có bất kỳ vết bẩn, vi khuẩn, dấu vết hoặc bụi bẩn

examples: The handle came loose.
They let loose a couple of rounds of ammunition.
The play has too many loose ends.
I'm tired of your playing fast and loose with me.
We still have one more loose end to deal with before we're finished with the project.
words.defineEn: not tight; not fitting tightly or closely
words.defineVi: không chật; không vừa vặn hoặc chặt chẽ

examples: Airport security was extra tight in the wake of yesterday's bomb attacks.
The recent strike has put the airline company in a tight spot.
Jane sure ran a tight ship around here.
Shaona was running a tight ship and didn't waste time on small talk.
He hung tight for 50 minutes, awaiting further instructions.
words.defineEn: (of clothes or shoes) fitting closely or firmly, especially in an uncomfortable way
words.defineVi: (quần áo hoặc giày dép) vừa khít hoặc chắc chắn, đặc biệt là theo một cách không thoải mái

examples: Such cheap goods obviously rely on dirt cheap labor.
Such cheap goods obviously rely on dirt cheap labor.
It was dirt cheap.
He found a cheap flight deal for his vacation.
She bought cheap headphones, but the sound quality was poor.
The new restaurant is expensive.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
She bought an expensive dress for a special occasion.
He bought an expensive watch as a gift for his father.
The restaurant had expensive prices, but the food was delicious.
She wears her hair long.
This policy is no longer an effective means to an end.
Our players kept the pedal to the metal all season long.
The kids are under my feet all day long.
North Korea’s refusal had long been a sticking point.
words.defineEn: (of two points) having an above-average or big distance between them
words.defineVi: (của hai điểm) có khoảng cách trên trung bình hoặc lớn giữa chúng

examples: Short hair really becomes you.
The boss has a short fuse these days!
She made short work of her opponents.
We fell short of our goal in the competition.
As they say, short reckonings make long friends.
words.defineEn: having a below-average or small distance between two points
words.defineVi: có khoảng cách dưới trung bình hoặc nhỏ giữa hai điểm
